description: This unit provides students with the opportunity to experience mathematics as a problem-solving discipline and to explore how mathematical knowledge, both within the discipline itself and within individual learners, develops from activity (mental as well as physical) and to reflect upon such activity. Prospective primary school teachers may not have had positive experiences of mathematics and may not be confident of their mathematics. Therefore, the unit challenges students in a supportive environment through 'low threshold' activities designed to promote understanding of mathematical concepts and processes (proficiencies), and build confidence so that students see themselves as mathematically able learners and teachers. The chosen activities have 'high ceilings' that allow the more mathematically confident students to stretch their thinking. Mathematics has its own value and beauty and this unit aims to develop an appreciation of the elegance and power of mathematical reasoning.
